title: Acting Prime Minister

content.text: (1) Whenever the Prime Minister is absent from Malta or on vacation, or is unable by reason of illness to perform the functions of his office, the President may authorise any other member of the Cabinet to perform those functions (other than the functions conferred by this article) and that member may perform those functions until his authority is revoked by the President.

(2) The powers of the President under this article shall be exercised by him in accordance with the advice of the Prime Minister: Provided that if the President considers that it is impracticable to obtain the advice of the Prime Minister owing to his absence or illness he may exercise those powers without that advice.

notes: This article establishes the procedure for appointing an Acting Prime Minister when the Prime Minister is absent, on vacation, or unable to perform the functions of office due to illness.
